_header: The Rose it is the fairest flower
Subjects: carols, political; Henry V; France, expedition to (1415); Agincourt
_description: ‘The Rose of Ryse’: a carol on Henry V and the Agincourt Campaign — three 6-line stanzas (aaaabb) and 4-line burden: ‘The rose es the fayreste flor of alle / That euermore wasse or euermore schall / The rose of ryse / Off all thies flourres the rose berys pryce’

BLAdd31042.First Lines: The Rose it es þe fairest flourþe Rose es swetteste of odour…
BLAdd31042.Last Lines: …In plesance of þe Rose so treweAnd chaungyde hewe
BLAdd31042.Attributed Title: A Carolle ffor Crystynmasse (left margin, f. 110v)
